name: Implante anticonceptivo (5 años)
summary: Implante subdérmico de larga duración que libera progestágeno, método anticonceptivo hormonal altamente efectivo.
advantages: No interfiere con el acto sexual
disadvantages: Requiere inserción y retiro por profesional de salud
Puede causar cambios en el patrón de sangrado
common_effects: Cambios en el patrón de sangrado
references: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists. (2023). Effectiveness of Birth Control Methods. ACOG. https://www.acog.org/womens-health/infographics/effectiveness-of-birth-control-methods
American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists. (2023). Birth Control. ACOG. https://www.acog.org/womens-health/healthy-living/birth-control

Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. (2020). U.S. Medical Eligibility Criteria for Contraceptive Use. Atlanta, GA: CDC. https://www.cdc.gov/reproductivehealth/contraception/mmwr/mec/summary.html
World Health Organization. (2018). Family Planning: A Global Handbook for Providers (3rd ed.). Geneva: WHO. https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/9789241565639
World Health Organization. (2025, July). Family planning/Contraception [Fact sheet]. https://www.who.int/es/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/family-planning-contraception
